hobby.message: Urban exploration ever get boring for you?
Still flying like no one's watching?

wrong_hobby_answer: That's not me. In free time, I fly FPV drones. It's a way to escape the noise of the city.
neutral_answer: Feels louder than usual. Too many people wandering tonight.
Hard to focus on flying drones with everyone out.
I keep my runs short now.
Some changes make things harder, that's all.
There's a lot more noise. Patrols moving around, people restless.
It throws off my drone sessions. Can't keep a steady route.
Guess everyone's looking for something after the system shut down.
Usually I can fly unnoticed, but not right now.
Feels like the gaps make people bold.
Yeah, pretty loud. Streets are off-schedule—BCI suspension has everyone improvising.
I fly FPV drones. Normally it's quiet out by the yards.
Last week, there were arguments near my usual launch spot.
No BCI geofences now, but less order too.
Makes flying different. Feels like there's no rules right now.
Kind of messes with my rhythm, honestly.
It's loud tonight. Manual controls, everyone acting out, even in the old zones.
I take FPV drones out to clear my head—industrial sector, mostly.
This week, no BCI watches, but more people out—patrols, neighbors, a few scavengers.
Last flight, I heard shouting over fuel at the yard. Never used to hear that.
Flying without system overlays is oddly tense. No structure, just noise.
I prefer the order, even if it was tight.
Feels like each change shifts the whole airspace around.
Loud in ways you don't expect. Since the BCI failed, routine's gone—and everyone senses it.
I fly custom FPV drones after work—industrial rooftops and substation gaps.
Used to count on the city being predictable. Security sweeps, automated warnings. Safe enough if you knew the lines.
Now, with BCI blind, streets are full of people policing themselves.
I tried a new line last night and ran into a neighborhood watch. They nearly took my gear for sabotage.
Flying's riskier—no official rules, but all these unwritten ones popping up.
Honestly, I miss the digital trails. At least the system's errors were logical.
Right now, even the sky feels unsettled—it's like the ground's shifting under my favorite path.
hobby_answer: Yeah, mostly clean.
Haven't lost a quad yet.
Been quiet out by the tracks.
Everybody’s distracted with the score outage anyway.
FPV routes are clear enough. Depends where you go now.
Industrial district’s less patrolled. Saw more neighborhood groups, though.
Harder to read people when the system’s down.
Don’t fly as long these days. Feels off.
FPV routes are pretty empty lately.
Since the BCI pause, security’s been light. More locals wandering, though.
Had to cut a flight short when people argued over diesel storage.
Weird flying without alerts. Miss the network sometimes.
Clears my head, but now it feels exposed.
FPV runs have been odd all week.
No BCI overlays, so flights feel cleaner but riskier.
Last time out, stumbled on locals guarding fuel. No patrols moved in.
I hit record and left. Didn’t feel safe—the old structure’s missing.
Honestly, drone work used to feel private. City’s too unpredictable now.
Still prefer the quiet out there, despite the tension.
Yeah, flying helps but not like before all this BCI collapse.
No telemetry shadows, but no structure either. Routes are wilder—too many unknowns.
Last run, neighborhood guards almost spotted me—used to trust the patterns, not people.
Sometimes I check system pings out of habit. Miss that false sense of order.
Pretty sure my score would tank if they saw these flights lately.
I started flying after my brother vanished—lets me watch from above. Feels tense now.
People out there don’t ask questions, but everyone’s on edge.
Part of me wonders if open air is freedom or just new noise.
Either way, still beats therapists and crowded bars.
